page.title: 14HISTORICAL WICKWAR (2)
page.content: WICKWAR WAS A TOWN THAT MANUFACTURED CLOTH IN THE MIDDLE AGES.IT MUST HAVE BEEN RATHER IMPORTANT FOR IT WAS GRANTED A CHARTER BY A KING SO THAT IT WAS ESTABLISHED AS A BOROUGH c.1285. A MONTHLY MARKET AND A BI- ANNUAL FAIR COULD BE NOW BE HELD IN WICKWAR. THE "PACK HORSE "BRIDGE WAS THE CROSSING USED BY THE TRADERS AS THEY TRAVELLED AROUND BUYING AND SELLING. THE PRESENT CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1500A.D. AND IS DEDICATED TO THE HOLY TRINITY.EVIDENCE DOES EXIST OF AN EARLIER CHURCH, PROBABLY BUILT BY THE LORD OF THE MANOR.THE CHURCH IS IN VERY GOOD ORDER AND CONTAINS SOME INTERESTING MEMORABILIA. THE TOWN HALL HAS WHAT IS REGARDED AS THE OLDEST WORKING TOWN HALL CLOCK IN THE COUNTRY ON ITS RECENTLY REFURBISHED STONEWORK.
